metadata.title: CVE-2021-42378 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
A use-after-free in Busybox's awk applet leads to denial of service and possibly code execution when processing a crafted awk pattern in the getvar_i function

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-42378` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

busybox - 1:1.30.1-6ubuntu3.1
busybox-initramfs - 1:1.30.1-6ubuntu3.1
busybox-static - 1:1.30.1-6ubuntu3.1
busybox-syslogd - 1:1.30.1-6ubuntu3.1
udhcpc - 1:1.30.1-6ubuntu3.1
udhcpd - 1:1.30.1-6ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

advisory.discovered_by: Vera Mens, Uri Katz, Tal Keren, Sharon Brizinov, and Shachar Menashe

notes.note: ccdm94> fix (importing awk.c from busybox version >= 1.34.0 due to large amount of changes made to the awk.c code) introduces a regression to busybox awk in xenial and earlier. Applying changes from the commit which prevents this regression from happening (237bedd499c) could result in further regressions being introduced to other applets in busybox. This happens because interfaces for applets are altered in this commit, and the calls to get them executed through busybox are modified. External applications which use busybox could end up with regressions as well because of this.

criterions.comment: busybox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.30.1-6ubuntu3.1').
